revised_title: Fergus William Campbell: A Pioneering Neurosensory Physiologist
tldr: Fergus William Campbell was a renowned neurosensory physiologist who made significant contributions to the field of human vision, particularly in the area of Fourier theory. He is remembered for his kindness, skill as an experimentalist, and his passion for discussing scientific ideas. His work in ophthalmology and collaboration with T.C.D. Whiteside led to advancements in understanding the depth of focus of the eye and the study of retinal vascularization in rats.
